title: When someone backbites us, we take some of their good deed, what if they SLANDER us? assim al hakeem
transcript: Hamza from Bosnia Assalamu Alaikum Wa Rahmatullahi Wa Barakatuhu Sheikh, we know from the hadith that when someone backbites us we take some of their good deeds Is there some evidence in Islam which tells us what do we get when someone goes an extra step and actually slaunders us? Barakallah Wafikum Sheikh. Wafikum Barakallah. It's the same hadith The hadith of the Prophet alayhis salatu wasalam when he said Atadroona man al-muflis? Do you know who is the one who's broke? and all of this is regarding the issue of slaundering, backbiting Shedding the blood, beating, doing, taking money, any aggression This is the price of it that you will take from their good deeds
